vocabInfos.lsjDefs:
ἀλλοτριόω,
estrange from: with genitive, deprive, τῶν σωμάτων τὴν πόλιν οὐκ ἀλλοτριοῦντες[Refs 5th c.BC+]; τοὺς ἠλλοτριωκότας ἑαυτοὺς ἀπὸ τῆς λῃτουργίας those who have withdrawn themselves from.., [Refs 4th c.BC+]
__2 with dative person, make hostile to another, τὴν χώραν τοῖς πολεμίοις[Refs 5th c.BC+]:—passive, become estranged, be made enemy, τινί[Refs 5th c.BC+]; πρός τι to be prejudiced against thing, [Refs 1st c.BC+]disguise oneself from, [LXX]; πρὸς τὰ καίοντα to be inaccessible to cautery, [Refs 2nd c.AD+]
__3 to be unnatural, have a strange taste, τροφὴν-ιοῦσαν ἔκπτυε[Refs 1st c.BC+]
__4 passive, to be alienated from one's natural condition, [Refs 5th c.BC+]
__5 passive, also of things, to be alienated, fall into other hands, ἀλλοτριοῦται ἡ ἀρχή[Refs 5th c.BC+]
